intro: Tanacetum pallens, commonly known as the white tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic, often medicinal properties. Tanacetum pallens has been historically used in herbal medicine for its purported antiseptic and digestive benefits.
